Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhead: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.

Three women stabbed in the Paris metro, a suspect has been arrested
subhead: The attacks took place at the Arts-et-Métiers, République, and Opéra stations, in the heart of the capital city, 'between 4:15 pm and 4:45 pm,' according to the RATP public transport authority.

title: 'No, monetary policy is not to blame for France's problems'
subhead: Olivier Garnier, the chief economist at the Banque de France, argues in an op-ed for Le Monde that central banks have recently succeeded in taming inflation without triggering a recession or even a significant rise in unemployment, in contrast to previous economic shocks.

title: At Marseille's MuCEM, an exhibition explores the sunken island of Ferdinandea
subhead: Until September 20, 2026, at the MuCEM in Marseille, artist Clément Cogitore dedicates an exhibit to Ferdinandea, a short-lived island off the coast of Sicily that appeared in the 19th century following a volcanic eruption and was later submerged.

title: Alexia Duchêne, from 'Top Chef' to New York: 'Americans love the spectacle'
subhead: Former 'Top Chef' semi-finalist Alexia Duchêne opened Le Chêne restaurant in New York in May. In a bourgeois setting, the chef showcases French culinary expertise to an enthusiastic New York clientele. Her cuisine, focused on luxury and opulence, stands in contrast to the bistronomy trend popular with her generation.

Why more young people are turning to religion
subhead: Many researchers have observed a resurgence of religious commitment among young people in France, often accompanied by a certain rigorism. This renewed spiritual quest is linked both to the anxieties of our era and, at times, a search for identity.

title: Semiconductors: Nvidia at the heart of the new Pacific battle
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (1/5):  Whether it's AI, electronics or defense, the 'silicon economy' drives the entire industrial and service sectors. It is at the heart of a fierce battle between global powers, with China seeking to free itself from dependence on US technologies.

title: 'Drone overflights are testing our defense capabilities,' says French military intelligence and security chief
subhead: Despite heightened vigilance from his teams, General Aymeric Bonnemaison, director of the French military security agency, admits that it remains difficult to identify the culprits of suspicious incidents. Since September, there has been a sharp increase in drone overflights of military installations.
